text: Rob Schröder (13 November 1950 – 6 July 2024) was a Dutch graphic designer and cineast. Schröder was born in Oegstgeest and grew up in Hoorn. He started working at the Rietveld Academie from 1971. He was co-founder of the designer collective in 1974, and was co-founders of the Sandberg Institute. As a writer and director for the VPRO, he was most known for his documentaries Allerzielen (2005) and Ouwehoeren (2011) and for his film Possessed (2018). Schröder died in Amsterdam on 6 July 2024, at the age of 73 from cancer. ==References== Category:Dutch designers Category:Television people Category:1950 births Category:2024 deaths Category:People from South Holland
title: Rob Schröder
